intro: Paederia chinensis var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leafed paederia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
